mecard.util

Class City

  • java.lang.Object
    • mecard.util.City
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AlbertaCity

    public abstract class City
extends java.lang.Object
    Does a lookup for city code in the city_st.properties file.
    Author:
    Andrew Nisbet

    • Method Detail

      • getCity

        public static final java.lang.String getCity(java.lang.String p)
        Deprecated. 
        Does a lookup for city code in the city_st.properties file. The city code is required and the codes are defined by each library that uses Horizon.
        Parameters:
        p -
        Returns:
        city code suitable for this instance of Horizon's city_st fields.

      • getCity

        public static final java.lang.String getCity(java.lang.String fullCityName,
                       boolean debug)
        Deprecated. 
        Does a lookup for city code in the city_st.properties file. The city code is required and the codes are defined by each library that uses Horizon.
        Parameters:
        fullCityName -
        Returns:
        city code suitable for this instance of Horizon's city_st.

      • getCityCode

        public abstract java.lang.String getCityCode(java.lang.String ciyName)
        Translates city names into mapped codes, primarily for Horizon but also useful for normalization of city names. Currently only Alberta cities are implemented.
        Parameters:
        ciyName -
        Returns:
        the code for that city, or the default field value if it wasn't found.
        See Also:
        AlbertaCity

      • isPlaceName

        public abstract boolean isPlaceName(java.lang.String placeName)
        This method allows you to check a string of unknown contents to see if it is a known place name for a given region.
        Parameters:
        placeName -
        Returns:
        true if placeName string is a known place name and false otherwise.

      • getPlaceNameLike

        public abstract java.lang.String getPlaceNameLike(java.lang.String place)
        Performs a fuzzy search for a place name that contains the argument string.
        Parameters:
        place - the partial name of a place to find.
        Returns:
        the full place name or empty string if the place name fragment didn't match anything.

      • getPlaceNames

        public abstract java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPlaceNames(java.lang.String place)
        Returns a list of names that ended with argument string.
        Parameters:
        place - name of a place or fragment like 'Valley'.
        Returns:
        list of all matches of known place names that end with the argument. In the case of 'Lake' it would contain "Cold Lake" and "Pigeon Lake", or if there were not matches the list will be empty.
